explanation: Funds are required to assess and strengthen the domestic industrial base and supply chain for Printed Circuit Boards (PrCBs), the domestic production of which has declined 90 percent since 1980 primarily due to the predatory tactics of China. Funds will support initiatives to develop domestic PrCB manufacturing capability/capacity to maintain advanced U.S. military superiority. Section 2533d of Title 10, United States Code, repealed by section 1881(a) of the National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2021, Public Law 116-283, had restricted DoD acquisition of certain PrCBs from North Korea, the Peoples Republic of China, the Russian Federation and the Islamic Republic of Iran. Efforts will focus on enabling the domestic PrCB industrial base to keep pace with the technical advances of microelectronics devices, delivering advanced manufacturing processes and materials for domestic production of packaging at very finite feature sizes, and providing domestic production capacity for organic substrates. This is a congressional special interest item.

Funds are required to update the business rules platform of the Market Research Center of Excellence (MCROE), a suite of tools used by DoD’s acquisition workforce including small business professionals. The updated platform will provide acquisition professionals with real-time market intelligence data for advanced market research and will leverage data analytics principles to conduct comparative analysis across DoD and other federal agencies for small business performance. The result will provide a broader technology and toolkit for the acquisition workforce, increase small business set aside competitions, and identify domestic suppliers that can meet DoD’s industrial base requirements in critical sectors. This is a congressional special interest item.

Funds are available for transfer pursuant to section 8132 of division C of Public Law 116-260 to assess and strengthen the manufacturing and defense industrial base and supply chain resiliency of the United States. This is a base budget funding.
